Perfect! I've successfully updated the date display in the top navbar with the following changes:

## Changes Made:

1. **Right-justified the date display**: Added `margin-left: auto` to the `.date-display` CSS class to push it all the way to the right within the flex container.

2. **Updated the time/date format**: Modified the `updateDate()` JavaScript function to:
   - Display current time in 12-hour format (e.g., "2:38pm")
   - Include full date with year (e.g., "Tue, Sep 16 2025")
   - Combine them in the requested format: **"2:38pm Tue, Sep 16 2025"**

3. **Real-time updates**: Changed the update interval from every minute to every second (1000ms) so the time stays current.

4. **Maintained sidebar simplicity**: The sidebar date display still shows just the day/date without time to keep it clean and compact.

The date display will now appear fully right-justified in the header and show the current time along with the date in exactly the format you requested. The existing mobile responsive design already handles hiding the date display on smaller screens where space is limited.
